vocabulary.english: to give something to someone (DF(DO), root = bigay)
to put something on/in something (DF(DO), root = lagay)
to teach something to someone (DF(DO), root = turo)
to go somewhere; go to someone (DF(D), root = punta)
to look at something (DF(D), root = tingin)

contents.markdown: •	DF -_an _verbs are either DF(DO) or DF(D) (directional focus double object or directional).
•	DF(DO) means attention is drawn to the IO and it takes _ang _form.
•	DF(D) means attention is drawn to the directional complement (dc), and it takes _ang _form.
•	They often have the nuance of doing something in the direction of something.
Standard Sentence(DO) = Verb + Actor + Object + IO
We can tailor that to DF verbs:
**Notes: Actor takes _ng _form, object takes _ng _form and IO takes _ang _form. For imperative, verb takes infinitive, actor is either _mo, ninyo _or _natin_. **

item.tagalog: Lalagyan ni Vanessa ng baso ang lamesa.
item.english: Vanessa will put a glass on the table.

item.tagalog: Tinuruan ng guro ng Ingles si Joe.
item.english: The teacher taught English to Joe.

contents.markdown: Notice that the IO is in italics now, since it is the focus.
We can tailor that to DF verbs:
**Notes: Actor takes _ng _form and dc takes _ang _form. For imperative, verb takes infinitive, actor is either _mo, ninyo _or _natin_. **

item.english: We (excl.) go to (visit) them every day.

exampleSentences.tagalog: Bigyan ninyo nga po sila ng pera sa gabi.
exampleSentences.english: (you pl.) Give them money at night. (soft)(resp.)

exampleSentences.tagalog: Nilagyan ng anak mo ng baso ang lamesa.
exampleSentences.english: Your kid put a glass on the table.

exampleSentences.tagalog: Hindi kami tinuturuan ni Sir Santos ng Ingles, no?
exampleSentences.english: Mr. Santos does not teach us(excl.) English, does he?

exampleSentences.tagalog: Pupuntahan non ang Cebu nang tatlong beses sa Enero.
exampleSentences.english: That will go to Cebu three times in January.

exampleSentences.tagalog: Tingnan mo ang basketbol sa kalsada.
exampleSentences.english: Look at the basketball in the street.

exampleSentences.tagalog: Binigyan kita ng masarap na tsokolate kahapon, di ba?
exampleSentences.english: I gave you some delicious chocolate yesterday, right?

exampleSentences.tagalog: Nilalagyan namin ng bisikleta ang gusali araw-araw.
exampleSentences.english: We put a bicycle in the building every day.

exampleSentences.tagalog: Tuturuan sila ni Luis nang isang oras sa ikapito ng Mayo.
exampleSentences.english: Luis will teach them for one hour on the seventh of May.

exampleSentences.tagalog: Magandang puntahan ang Maynila sa hapon.
exampleSentences.english: It is good to go to Manila in the afternoon.

exampleSentences.tagalog: Tinitingnan ng apat na bata ang pinto ngayon.
exampleSentences.english: Four kids are looking at the door now.
